intro: Araujia megapotamica, commonly known as the moonflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its large, fragrant white flowers that open at night. The plant is a climbing vine with woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers have five petals and emit a strong, sweet scent to attract nocturnal pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds with silky hair, aiding in wind dispersal.
